message.content:
cs.CL, cs.IR, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.NE 

This paper is about building a model for response selection in retrieval-based chatbot systems. The model uses background documents to ground conversation contexts and recognize important information for matching. This involves natural language processing (NLP) techniques such as document representation, context representation, and hierarchical interaction. Therefore, the most likely arXiv CS sub-category is cs.CL (Computation and Language), which deals with NLP and related topics. The paper also involves information retrieval (IR) techniques for matching, which suggests cs.IR (Information Retrieval) as the second likely sub-category. The paper also uses machine learning (ML) techniques such as neural networks, which suggests cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) and cs.LG (Machine Learning) as likely sub-categories. Finally, the paper involves dynamic determination of importance, which suggests cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing) as a possible sub-category.
